title: TO MISS PEABODY
content: TO MISS PEABODY Custom House, Novr. 14th [1839] My dearest Wife, May God sustain you under this affliction. I have long dreaded it for your sake. Oh, let your heart be full of love for me now, and realise how entirely my happiness depends on your well-being. You are not your own, dearest—you must not give way to grief. Were it possible, I would come to see you now. I will write you again on Saturday. Your Own Husband. My dearest, this note seems cold and lifeless to me, as if there were no tenderness nor comfort in it. Think for yourself all that I cannot speak. Miss Sophia A. Peabody, Care of Dr. N. Peabody, Salem, Mass.
